lead_paragraph: Nobody likes to think they sold at the bottom of the market — which might explain why this year has begun with so many hostile takeover bids. Microsoft‘s bid for Yahoo is easily the largest so far in 2008; Yahoo has called price the much too low and is casting around for white knights. In Britain, the insurance company Friends Provident recently rejected a takeover proposal from the private equity firm J.C. Flowers & Company. Diebold spurned a bid from United Technologies in late February, just a few days after Take-Two Interactive said no to an offer from Electronic Arts.

headline.main: A Bull Market for Hostile Bids
